paper_abstract: We call F : {0, 1}(n) x {0, 1}(n) {0, 1}(n) -> {0,1} symmetric XOR function if for a function S : (0, 1, ... , n} -> {0, 1), F(x, y) = S(vertical bar x circle plus y vertical bar), for any x, y is an element of {0, 1}(n), where vertical bar x circle plus y vertical bar is the Hamming weight of the bit-wise XOR of x and y. We show that for any such function, (a) the deterministic communication complexity is always circle minus(n) except for four simple functions that have a constant complexity, and (b) up to a polylog factor, both the error-bounded randomized complexity and quantum communication with entanglement. complexity are circle minus(r(0) + r(1)), where r(0) and r(1) are the minimum integers such that r(0), r(1) <= n/2 and S(k) = S(k + 2) for all k is an element of (r(0), n-r(1)).
paper_title: COMMUNICATION COMPLEXITIES OF SYMMETRIC XOR FUNCTIONS
